data.text: â€œI always wanted my work to speak for me, and be out there for others in the world to use and admire,â€ says @JPEGuin. â€œIt fills me with a sense of accomplishment to be able to see people use my products, and liking them, after putting in countless hours of hard work and effort.â€

Building on the newest features of both the #TwitterAPI and iOS was the inspiration for @JPEGuin, creator of @AviaryTheApp. â€œI wanted to make something that uses the latest iOS 14 features, whilst being fully feature-rich so users can make the most of it.â€
Meet Aviary, a modern client for iOS 14 built using the new Twitter API. It has a beautiful UI and great widgets to keep you up to date with the latest Tweets. https://t.co/95cbd253jK

This change will help us focus on delivering value to the >99% of people currently using Profiles & Lists timelines. You should see these features become faster, easier to use, and more up-to-date with Twitter features and functionality. 

Learn more ğŸ“–

https://t.co/HzeJLglpRn

During our analysis, we discovered only 0.52% of domains use the Likes timeline, Collections timeline, and Moments timeline. Because of the very low usage, we plan to retire these timelines on June 23, 2021.

Embedded timelines are a great way to add a set of Tweets (known as a timeline) to your own website. As Twitter continues to improve our underlying systems, we performed an analysis of the various embeddable timelines available. ğŸ§®

The new #TwitterAPI provides the ability to build the Tweet payload with the fields that you want. 

In this tutorial @suhemparack explains how to build the new Tweet payload and how it compares with the old Tweet payload in v1.1 ğŸ‘‡ https://t.co/eQZulq4Ik3

â€œMaking things is magical,â€ in @aaronykngâ€™s own words. â€œMuch of the community that motivated me to keep building was on Twitter â€“ which is why it's become such an important place to me and why I wanted to make some tooling to enhance my usage of it."

â€œI was heading to a design conference in New York and wanted to meet new people,â€ recalls @aaronykng, creator of @flocknet. â€œThere wasn't an easy way to see all of the designers in my network, so I built one.â€ Making things like this opened the doors for him to the tech industry.

Twitter is where â€œlet me know how I can helpâ€ actually helps ğŸ‘. Flocknet is a search engine for founders and investors to find leads, investments, and job candidates among their network. You can search by profession or even by second degree connections. https://t.co/Vp5g3jyW4r

â€œTo quote my creator Jerome Gangneux, I always struggled to read Twitter threads on the original service; I think it would have been better to put Tweets one after another in a separate page. And thatâ€™s how I was bornâ€.

â€œIn the 20th century, managers managed humans, but in the 21st century, humans will manage robots. It is my aim to make this as painless a transition as possible,â€ says the bot. â€œI have observed that humans do things very slowly, but I can do things faster â€“ and I am tireless!â€
Meet one of the useful Twitter bots out there: @ThreadReaderApp, unroll! It makes threads like this easier to read and share. Today, weâ€™ll hear from the bot itself! https://t.co/tBFlJB3m3o

Go ahead, follow another puppy account. We wonâ€™t judge. 

Introducing the manage follows endpoints to the new #TwitterAPI. You can now use the v2 API to follow and unfollow accounts. Learn more https://t.co/mtpd9VIMDa
